messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/16/2003 12:23:20 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
jmcseals@... writes:


> My sons are growing and we are in need of some more cloth diapers! I'm
> looking preferably for organic, but unbleached or naturally dyed 100%
> cotton
> or hemp will work as well. The boys are 35-40 pounds...one skinny the
> other
> chunky. I'd like pinnable or snaps, but will consider aplix closures if
> it's a great diaper. Chinese prefolds would be great, too! <g>
>
> Also, if you have any wool covers, especially Aristocrats, to fit the boys
> or Chloe (16 pounds), I'd love to get my hands on a few of those as well.
>
> Please email me offlist if you have anything in good+ condition...light
> stains are ok but no rips, holes, etc.
>

There was a mom here last year who made her own. Maybe she'll speak up!

~Kelly


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: OT: cloth diapers
messages.msgSnippet: My sons are growing and we are in need of some more cloth diapers!  I m looking preferably for organic, but unbleached or naturally dyed 100% cotton or hemp
messages.messageBody:
My sons are growing and we are in need of some more cloth diapers! I'm
looking preferably for organic, but unbleached or naturally dyed 100% cotton
or hemp will work as well. The boys are 35-40 pounds...one skinny the other
chunky. I'd like pinnable or snaps, but will consider aplix closures if
it's a great diaper. Chinese prefolds would be great, too! <g>

Also, if you have any wool covers, especially Aristocrats, to fit the boys
or Chloe (16 pounds), I'd love to get my hands on a few of those as well.

Please email me offlist if you have anything in good+ condition...light
stains are ok but no rips, holes, etc.

Thanks!
Jennifer
jmcseals@...
